info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 3:47AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...LIGHT WINTRY MIX POSSIBLE THIS MORNING... An approaching low pressure system will bring abundant moisture and a chance of light precipitation this morning. Meanwhile, cold and dry air will push south along the east side of the Appalachians. Some areas near the east-facing Blue Ridge Escarpment, north of Interstate 40, will be near freezing when the precipitation begins this morning. A wintry mix of rain and freezing rain, and potentially some sleet, is possible in these areas. Although any ice accretion is expected to be light and mainly on elevated surface, some slick spots could develop on roadways, especially bridges and overpasses. Slippery road conditions may last into midday. Drive with extra caution if traveling this morning.
